info.name: Imburse API
info.description:
Welcome to the Imburse API. You can use our APIs to access Imburse portal and Payment API endpoints. # Authentication To authorize, use this code: ```shell # With shell, you can just pass the correct header with each request $ curl "api_endpoint_here" -H "Authorization: Hmac {token}" ``` Imburse issues API keys to allow access to the API. We issue both `Client API Tokens`, for accessing client functionality, and `Account API Tokens` for accessing the clients' parent account. You can manage your API keys in the Imburse Portal dashboard or via the API. Your API tokens carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secret! Do not share your API `private keys` in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth. All API requests must be made over `HTTPS`. API requests without authentication will fail. ## HMAC Authentication Each request made to Imburse API's uses HMAC credentials and, with the signature, provides identity verification and in-transit data integrity. To generate a HMAC for your requests, please see our full step by step guide which can be found on our open source account under the [HMAC examples page](https://github.com/Imburse-Payments/hmac-examples) To complete the process you will need the `publicKey` and `privateKey` from a Client or Account API Token. To configurure the request header for HMAC, use `Authorization: Hmac {token}`.
You must replace {token} with your HMAC authentication token key.
# Access Control All API functions require an API token to authenticate - see [Authentication](#authentication). As part of the request when creating [Client API Tokens](#client-api-tokens), you can specify the `roles` available to the token. Each API operation documents the exact role required so you can taylor your tokens to specific roles if required. #### Client Roles Role name | Description -|- `client-read` | Read Clients `client-write` | Read and write Clients `client-token-read` | Read Client API Tokens `client-token-write` | Read and write Client API Tokens `client-whitelabel-write` | Read and write Client Whitelabel Settings `collection-scheme-read` | Read Collection Schemes `collection-scheme-write` | Read and write Collection Schemes `psp-configuration-read` | Read PSP Configurations `psp-configuration-write` | Read and write PSP Configurations #### Account Roles `Account API Tokens` are created by Imburse and cannot be changed. The `roles` assigned to these tokens are shown for reference only. Role name | Function -|- `account-read` | Read Accounts `account-token-read` | Read Account API Tokens `client-token-write` | Write Client API Tokens # Errors Imburse uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the **2xx** range indicate success, codes in the **4xx** range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, etc.), and codes in the **5xx** range indicate an error with Imburse's servers, Response Code | Meaning --------------| ------- 200 | **OK** - Everything worked as expected. 400 | **Bad Request** - The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter. 401 | **Unauthorized** - No valid API key provided. 402 | **Request Failed** - The parameters were valid but the request failed. 403 | **Forbidden** -- The request endpoint is not valid for your user or role. 404 | **Not Found** - The requested resource doesn't exist. 409 | **Conflict** - The request conflicts with another request (perhaps due to using the same idempotent key). 429 | **Too Many Requests** - Too many requests hit the API too quickly. We recommend an exponential backoff of your requests. 500, 502, 503, 504 | **Internal Server Error** - Something went wrong on Imburse's end. # Countries All API functions that reference a country will use the **ISO 3166-1 alpha-2** country code format. Use the list below to identify the country. Alpha 2 Code | Name -|- AF|Afghanistan AX|Åland AL|Albania DZ|Algeria AS|American Samoa AD|Andorra AO|Angola AI|Anguilla AQ|Antarctica AG|Antigua and Barbuda AR|Argentina AM|Armenia AW|Aruba AU|Australia AT|Austria AZ|Azerbaijan BS|Bahamas BH|Bahrain BD|Bangladesh BB|Barbados BY|Belarus BE|Belgium BZ|Belize BJ|Benin BM|Bermuda BT|Bhutan BO|Bolivia BQ|Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba BA|Bosnia and Herzegovina BW|Botswana BV|Bouvet Island BR|Brazil IO|British Indian Ocean Territory BN|Brunei Darussalam BG|Bulgaria BF|Burkina Faso BI|Burundi KH|Cambodia CM|Cameroon CA|Canada CV|Cape Verde KY|Cayman Islands CF|Central African Republic TD|Chad CL|Chile CN|China CX|Christmas Island CC|Cocos (Keeling) Islands CO|Colombia KM|Comoros CG|Congo (Brazzaville) CD|Congo (Kinshasa) CK|Cook Islands CR|Costa Rica CI|Côte d'Ivoire HR|Croatia CU|Cuba CW|Curaçao CY|Cyprus CZ|Czech Republic DK|Denmark DJ|Djibouti DM|Dominica DO|Dominican Republic EC|Ecuador EG|Egypt SV|El Salvador GQ|Equatorial Guinea ER|Eritrea EE|Estonia ET|Ethiopia FK|Falkland Islands FO|Faroe Islands FJ|Fiji FI|Finland FR|France GF|French Guiana PF|French Polynesia TF|French Southern Territories GA|Gabon GM|Gambia GE|Georgia DE|Germany GH|Ghana GI|Gibraltar GR|Greece GL|Greenland GD|Grenada GP|Guadeloupe GU|Guam GT|Guatemala GG|Guernsey GN|Guinea GW|Guinea-Bissau GY|Guyana HT|Haiti HM|Heard Island and McDonald Islands HN|Honduras HK|Hong Kong HU|Hungary IS|Iceland IN|India ID|Indonesia IR|Iran IQ|Iraq IE|Ireland IM|Isle of Man IL|Israel IT|Italy JM|Jamaica JP|Japan JE|Jersey JO|Jordan KZ|Kazakhstan KE|Kenya KI|Kiribati KP|Korea, North KR|Korea, South KW|Kuwait KG|Kyrgyzstan LA|Laos LV|Latvia LB|Lebanon LS|Lesotho LR|Liberia LY|Libya LI|Liechtenstein LT|Lithuania LU|Luxembourg MO|Macao MK|Macedonia MG|Madagascar MW|Malawi MY|Malaysia MV|Maldives ML|Mali MT|Malta MH|Marshall Islands MQ|Martinique MR|Mauritania MU|Mauritius YT|Mayotte MX|Mexico FM|Micronesia MD|Moldova MC|Monaco MN|Mongolia ME|Montenegro MS|Montserrat MA|Morocco MZ|Mozambique MM|Myanmar NA|Namibia NR|Nauru NP|Nepal NL|Netherlands NC|New Caledonia NZ|New Zealand NI|Nicaragua NE|Niger NG|Nigeria NU|Niue UZ|Uzbekistan VU|Vanuatu VA|Vatican City VE|Venezuela VN|Vietnam VG|Virgin Islands, British VI|Virgin Islands, U.S. WF|Wallis and Futuna EH|Western Sahara YE|Yemen ZM|Zambia ZW|Zimbabwe # Currencies All API functions that reference a Currency Code will use the **ISO 4217 alphabetic code** format. Use the list below to identify the currency. Alphabetic Code | Name -|- CHF | Swiss Franc EUR | Euro GBP | Pound Sterling USD | United States Dollar

item.name: Accounts
item.description:
Account objects allow you to perform updates to your account. Use the account object to update your contact address, as well as retrieve your account details. You can also retrieve a list of the clients attached to your account as well as create a new client for your account.

## The account object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
billingContactFirstName | string | First name of the billing contact
billingContactLastName | string | Last name of the billing contact
billingContactAddress | [address object](#the-address-object) | The billing contact address

## The address object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
streetAddress | string | First line of address
extendedAddress | string | Second line of an address if requried
locality | string | The locality / city
region | string | The region / state / county
postCode | string | The post code / zip code
country | string | The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

request.description:
#### Description

Creates a new client attached to your account.

#### Role required

`account-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
accountId | The id of the account to create a client under

#### Description

Retrieves the details of an existing account.

#### Role required

`account-read`

#### Params
Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
accountId | The id of the account to retrieve

#### Description

Retrieves the details of an existing account.

#### Role required

`account-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
accountId | The id of the account to retrieve

item.name: Account API Tokens
item.description:
Account API Token objects allow you to manage your account tokens. The API allows you to create new tokens as well as retrieve tokens. You can also get the private key from a given public key.

## The account API token object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
publicKey | string | The token's public key
privateKey | string | The token's private key (secret)
name | string | The friendly name for this token
scopes | array of [Scope](#the-scope-object) objects | Defines scopes that this token has permission to use

### The scope object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
scopeName | string | The name of the scope. i.e `Client-API` or `Payments-API`. Scope name is **case-sensitive**.
claims | array of [Claim](#the-claim-object) objects | Defines the claims and roles for a given scope

### The claim object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
roles | array of [Roles](#role-names) string | A list of roles permitted in the parent scope. Permitted roles names are: `client-read`, `client-write`, `client-token-read`, `client-token-write`, `collection-scheme-read`, `collection-scheme-write`, `psp-configuration-read`, `psp-configuration-write`

request.description:
#### Description

Creates a new Client API Token. 

Use this operation to create a new token for your client to use to access the client specific operations. 

**Note:** The response will return the newly generated `publicKey` and `privateKey`. You must **record** the `privateKey` after it has been created as it is **NOT** retrievable afterwards. 

If you lose the `privateKey` for a token you will need to create a new token.

#### Role required

`client-token-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
accountId | The id of the account that owns the client specified below
clientId | The id of the client that the token is to be created for. The client must be owned by the account id specified.

#### Description

Gets a list of Account Tokens.

#### Role required

`account-token-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
accountId | The id of the account that owns the tokens

#### Description

Gets the details of an existing Account API Token.

#### Role required

`account-token-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
accountId | The id of the account that owns the token
publicKey | The `publicKey` of the token to retrieve

item.name: Clients
item.description:
Client objects allow you to perform updates to clients. The API allows you to create, delete, and update your clients. You can retrieve individual clients as well as a list of all your clients.

## The client object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
name | string | The clients name 
address | [address](#the-address-object) object | The client address
whiteLabelSettings | [White Label document](#the-white-label-settings-object) object | The white label settings for the client. ie. logo, styling document etc.

## The address object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
streetAddress | string | First line of address
extendedAddress | string | Second line of an address if requried
locality | string | The locality / city
region | string | The region / state / county
postCode | string | The post code / zip code
country | string | The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

request.description:
#### Description

Uploads a logo for the client white label settings.

#### Role required

`client-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client to update

#### Description

Uploads a styling document for the client white label settings.

#### Role required

`client-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client to update

#### Description

Retrieves the details of an existing client.

#### Role Required

`client-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client to retrieve

#### Description

Updates the address of an existing client object.

#### Role Required

`client-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client to update

item.name: Client API Tokens
item.description:
Client API Token objects allow you to manage your client tokens. The API allows you to create new tokens as well as retrieve tokens. You can also invalidate an existing token.

## The client API token object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
publicKey | string | The token's public key
privateKey | string | The token's private key (secret)
name | string | The friendly name for this token
scopes | array of [Scope](#the-scope-object) objects | Defines scopes that this token has permission to use

### The scope object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
scopeName | string | The name of the scope. i.e `Client-API` or `Payments-API`. Scope name is **case-sensitive**.
claims | array of [Claim](#the-claim-object) objects | Defines the claims and roles for a given scope

### The claim object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
roles | array of [Roles](#role-names) string | A list of roles permitted in the parent scope. Permitted roles names are: `client-read`, `client-write`, `client-token-read`, `client-token-write`, `collection-scheme-read`, `collection-scheme-write`, `psp-configuration-read`, `psp-configuration-write`

request.description:
#### Description

Creates a new Client API Token. 

Use this operation to create a new token for your client.

**Note:** The response will return the newly generated `publicKey` and `privateKey`. You must **record** the `privateKey` after it has been created as it is **NOT** retrievable afterwards. 

If you lose the `privateKey` for a token you will need to create a new token.

#### Role required

`client-token-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that the token is to be created for.

#### Description

Gets a list of Client Tokens.

#### Role required

`client-token-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the tokens

#### Description

Gets the details of an existing Client API Token.

#### Role required

`client-token-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the tokens
publicKey | The `publicKey` of the token to retrieve

#### Description

Invalidating a token will render it unusable.

Use this operation when you want to disable a token.

#### Role required

`client-token-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The parent client id of the token.
publicKey | The publicKey of the token you that you want to invalidate.

item.name: PSP Configurations
item.description:
*Payment Service Provider* (PSP) configuration objects hold the connnection details that Imburse needs to connect to your PSP. With these details, we can carry out instructions on your behalf - such as credit card authorization and/or settlement. PSP configuration objects allow you to manage your PSP configurations for a given client. The API allows you to create, retrieve, and update your configurations.

## The PSP configuration object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
pspType | string | The name of the PSP. Currently only `BrainTree` is supported with these operations.
configuration | [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object | An object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

## The configuration object

This object will vary depending on the `pspType` the PSP configuration is for.

Listed below are the all the configuration types that are currently supported.

### The BrainTree configuration object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
merchantId | string | The `merchantId` for your BrainTree account
publicKey | string  | The `publicKey` for your BrainTree account
privateKey | string  | The `privateKey` for your BrainTree account

request.description:
# Description

Create a PSP configuration.

## Role required

`psp-configuration-write`

### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that will own the PSP Configuration

#### Request body

A JSON formatted object string.

Key name | Required | Description
--------- | ----------- | -----------
pspType | Yes | The name of the PSP. Currently only `BrainTree` is supported with these operations.
configuration | Yes | A [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

#### Description

Gets a list PSP configurations.

#### Role required

`psp-configuration-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the PSP Configurations

#### Description

Gets a PSP configuration.

#### Role required

`psp-configuration-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the PSP Configuration
pspConfigurationId | The id of the PSP configuration to retrieve

#### Description

Updates a PSP configuration.

#### Role required

`psp-configuration-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the PSP Configuration
pspConfigurationId | The id of the PSP Configuration to update

#### Request body

A JSON formatted object string.

Key name | Required | Description
--------- | ----------- | -----------
pspType | Yes | The name of the PSP. Currently only `BrainTree` is supported with these operations.
configuration | Yes | A [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

item.name: Collection Schemes
item.description:
Collection Scheme objects allow you to perform updates to your payment scheme collection settings. The API allows you to create new schemes, and add or update scheme country settings. You can retrieve individual schemes as well as a list of all your schemes for a given client.

## The collection scheme object

The collection scheme object holds details about a collection scheme, and is the parent to one or many scheme settings.

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
name | string | The scheme name 
schemeSettings | array | An array of `SchemeSetting` objects 

## The scheme setting object

The scheme settings object holds details that concern individual countries' available payment methods. 

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
country | string | The country code this scheme setting will apply to
paymentMethods | array | An array of `PaymentMethod` objects 

## The payment method object

The payment method object holds details that concern a particular payment method's availablilty.

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
pspId | guid | The unique identifier of the PSP (Payment Service Provider) providing services to the payment method
paymentMethodType | string | The name of the payment payment. ie. `visa-debit`, `paypal`, etc.
enabled | bool | Boolean value that determines if this payment method is currently enabled. 
key | string | A composite value of `pspId` and `paymentMethodType`

request.description:
#### Description 

Creates a new collection scheme. This will also create a scheme setting for this scheme at the same time.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes

#### Description 

Create a new scheme setting.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme that will own the new scheme setting

#### Description 

Get a list to collection schemes

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes

#### Description 

Get a collection schemes

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to get

#### Description 

Get a collection scheme setting

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to that owns the scheme setting
schemeSettingId | The id of the scheme setting to get

item.name: Get available payment methods for new scheme

request.description:
#### Description 

Gets a list of payment methods that are available for a given country code. 

Use this operation when creating a new scheme to find the available payment methods. 

Not all PSP's operate in all territories so this methods will return a list of all the payment methods available to you from the PSP's you have configured for your client.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
country | The country code that will filter the available payment methods

item.name: Get available payment methods for new scheme setting

request.description:
#### Description 

Gets a list of payment methods that are available to add to an existing scheme setting. 

Use this operation when your want to add extra payment methods to an existing scheme setting.

Not all PSP's operate in all territories so this methods will return a list of all the payment methods available to you from the PSP's you have configured for your client plus it will filter out the payment methods that have already been added to the specified scheme setting.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme that owns the scheme setting
schemeSettingId | The id of the schemeSetting to find the availalbe payment methods for

#### Description 

Updates a scheme.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to be updated

#### Description 

Updates a scheme setting.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme that will owns the scheme setting
schemeSettingId | The id of the scheme setting to update

#### Description 

Deletes a collection scheme.

**Note:** You cannot delete a scheme that still has scheme settings. Delete the individual scheme settings before deleting the scheme.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to delete

#### Description 

Deletes a scheme setting.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The parent scheme id of the scheme setting
schemeSettingId | The id of the scheme setting to delete

item.name: Collect Payments
item.description: ##### Request structure The following endpoints exist. While the style is RESTful-like, the transaction API is not a fully REST service. Scheme | URI | Description - | - | - `POST` | `/v1/collect` | Create a new collect transaction `GET` | `/v1/collect/{reference}` | Get transaction details `POST` | `/v1/collect/{reference}/token` | Recreate bearer token `POST` | `/v1/collect/{reference}/settle` | Settling a transaction `POST` | `/v1/collect/{reference}/void` | Voiding a transaction ##### Error Handling Validation or verification errors occuring during the life of a transaction will return a common `400 Bad Request` HTTP status code error in a common format. Property | Type | Description - | - | - `errors` | Array[string] | One or many standardized error codes representing the failure. `reason` | string, _null_ | Optional descriptive reason for the failure. More commonly used to describe why a payment partner rejected a request. ##### Server Errors > 500 Internal Server Error ```json { "correlationId": "abc...xyz", "timestamp": 1535458649, "message": null } ``` ##### Authorization limitations When creating a transaction you can specify whether you wish to `AUTHORIZE` or `SETTLE` the payment as soon as the customer provides their payment information. This is handled through the `instruction` property. If you choose to first hold the transaction in an `AUTHORIZED` state then you should be aware of the maximum length of time a transaction can be authorized for can differ based on the payment provider. Provider | Maximum held duration - | - AMEX | 7 days VISA | 10 days SWITCH | 30 days SOLO | 30 days MASTER CARD | 7 days MAESTRO | 30 days UK MAESTRO | 30 days LASER | 30 days JCB | 30 days DISCOVER | 30 days DINERS CLUB INTERNATIONAL | 30 days UNION PAY | 30 days CHINA UNION PAY | 30 days CARTE BLANCHE | 30 days #### Validation errors Subsequent settlement requests will result in the error code `AUTHORIZATION_HAS_EXPIRED`. #### Transaction Status The transaction status will have changed to `PAYMENT_AUTHORIZATION_EXPIRED`. #### Additional payments If you require additional payment you will need to create a new transaction and request your customer provide their card details again. A server error is identified by a `500 Internal Server Error` HTTP status code. If you're experiencing any server errors and require assistence then please include the server error response containing the `correlationId` property. This will help the team diagnose and trace the cause of any problems related to your transaction. ##### Note When a transaction cannot be found we will return a `400 Bad Request` HTTP status code with the error code `TRANSACTION_NOT_FOUND` rather than a `404 Not Found` HTTP status code.

request.description: This is the first stage required to create a new transaction. If successful, the response to this request will return a new `bearer token` valid for the life of the transaction. This bearer token is used by the whitelabel page to allow the customer to make a payment. See the White Label Workflow for more information. A collect transaction must be given a unique `reference`. The `reference` will be used throughout the transaction's life to query it's status, void or reconcile payment. #### Request Body The following parameters are sent in JSON format. Parameter | Type | Description - | - | - reference | string (50 char max) | A unique Client Reference to identify the collect transaction. This reference cannot be reused across transactions. This field has limited allowed characters (`a-z0-9-_.*+:@&=,!~;`). amount | decimal | The amount to be collected. currency | ISO3 | The currency to collect the payment in. country | ISO2 | The country in which the customer resides to localize payment options. scheme | string | The identifier of the `Scheme` in which to use. instruction | `AUTHORIZE` or `SETTLE` | Automatically Authorize or Settle the payment upon customer submission. ttl | timestamp | The amount of time (in seconds) the collect token will live for. Must be between 60 seconds and 14 days (1209600). customer | customer | The customer's billing details. ##### Customer Object Parameter | Type | Required | Description - | - | - | - firstName | string | Required | The customer's first name. lastName | string | Required | The customer's last name. companyName | string | Optional | The company name if associated with an address. addressLine1 | string | Required | The primary address line. addressLine2 | string | Optional | The secondary address line. city | string | Required | The address City or Town. state | string | Optional | The address State, County or Region. zipCode | string | Required | The address zip/postal code. country | ISO2 | Required | The address Country (in ISO2 format). #### Validation errors One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request. Code | Description - | - `REFERENCE_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required. `REFERENCE_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters. `REFERENCE_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.*+:@&=,!~;`. `REFERENCE_ALREADY_IN_USE` | Reference must be unique when creating a transaction. `REFERENCE_DOES_NOT_MATCH_URI` | If the reference exists in both the `URI` and the `BODY` then they must match. `AMOUNT_IS_REQUIRED` | Amount is required. `AMOUNT_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Amount was not recognised as a valid decimal. `AMOUNT_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_ZERO` | Amount cannot be less than or equal to zero. `CURRENCY_IS_REQUIRED` | Currency is required. `CURRENCY_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Currency was not a recognised ISO3 currency code. `COUNTRY_IS_REQUIRED` | Country is required. `COUNTRY_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Country was not a recognised ISO2 country code. `SCHEME_IS_REQUIRED` | Scheme is required. `SCHEME_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Scheme was not recognised as a valid `GUID`. `INSTRUCTION_IS_REQUIRED` | Instruction is required. `INSTRUCTION_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Instruction must be either `AUTHORIZE` or `SETTLE`. `TTL_IS_REQUIRED` | Token TTL is required. `TTL_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Token TTL must be a number representing how many seconds the token is to live for. `TTL_OUTSIDE_OF_ALLOWED_RANGE` | Token must have a life between 60 seconds and 14 days (1209600). `FIRST_NAME_IS_REQUIRED` | Customer first name is required. `LAST_NAME_IS_REQUIRED` | Customer last name is required. `ADDRESS_LINE_1_IS_REQUIRED` | Customer address line 1 is required. `CITY_IS_REQUIRED` | Customer city is required. `ZIP_CODE_IS_REQUIRED` | Customer zip code is required. #### Notes You can recreate a `bearer token` without needing to create a new collect transaction. It's important to remember that creating a new `bearer token` wont extend the life of the token. See Recreate a bearer token.

It is possible to recreate a `bearer token` for a transaction as long as the transaction is not `EXPIRED` or `VOIDED`.

Creating a new `bearer token` will not extend the life of the transaction, nor the `bearer token` itself. A `bearer token` will be invalidated at the same time the transaction is due to expire.


#### URL Parameters

The following parameters are to be sent in the URL

Parameter | Type | Description
- | - | -
reference | string (50 char max) | The unique transaction reference given during creation.

#### Validation errors

One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request.

Code | Description
- | - 
`REFERENCE_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`REFERENCE_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`REFERENCE_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.*+:@&=,!~;`.
`TRANSACTION_NOT_FOUND` | Reference didn't match a known transaction.
`TRANSACTION_IS_EXPIRED` | Cannot recreate a token for an `EXPIRED` transaction.
`TRANSACTION_IS_VOIDED` | Cannot recreate a token for a `VOIDED` transaction.

#### Settlement errors

The following error may occur if there were issues settling the payment.

More information is available in the `reason` property.

Code | Description
- | - 
`PROVIDER_FAILED` | There was an issue settling the payment with the provider. Additional information will be available in the `reason` property.

If a transaction is `AUTHORIZED` and requires manual settlement then you can do so using the following API. #### URL Parameters The following parameters are to be sent in the URL Parameter | Type | Description - | - | - reference | string (50 char max) | The unique transaction reference given during creation. #### Validation errors One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request. Code | Description - | - `REFERENCE_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required. `REFERENCE_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters. `REFERENCE_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.*+:@&=,!~;`. `TRANSACTION_NOT_FOUND` | Reference didn't match a known transaction. `TRANSACTION_NOT_AUTHORIZED` | The transaction has not been authorized by the customer yet. `TRANSACTION_IS_SETTLING` | The transaction is already settling. `TRANSACTION_HAS_SETTLED` | The transaction has settled. `AUTHORIZATION_HAS_EXPIRED` | The card provider has expired the authorized payment.
See Authorization limitations. #### Settlement errors The following error may occur if there were issues settling the payment. More information is available in the `reason` property. Code | Description - | - `PROVIDER_FAILED` | There was an issue settling the payment with the provider. Additional information will be available in the `reason` property.

A transaction can be voided at any time before it enters a `SETTLING` OR `SETTLED` state.


#### URL Parameters

The following parameters are to be sent in the URL

Parameter | Type | Description
- | - | -
reference | string (50 char max) | The unique transaction reference given during creation.

#### Validation errors

One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request.

Code | Description
- | - 
`REFERENCE_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`REFERENCE_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`REFERENCE_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.*+:@&=,!~;`.
`TRANSACTION_NOT_FOUND` | Reference didn't match a known transaction.
`TRANSACTION_IS_SETTLING` | A `SETTLING` transaction cannot be voided.
`TRANSACTION_HAS_SETTLED` | A `SETTLED` transaction cannot be voided.
`TRANSACTION_IS_VOIDED` | The transaction is already `VOIDED`.

Should you need to query a transaction status, or identify the values a transaction was created with, then you can do so using the following API.

#### URL Parameters

The following parameters are to be sent in the URL

Parameter | Type | Description
- | - | -
reference | string (50 char max) | The unique transaction reference given during creation.

#### Status Codes

Code | Description
---  | ---
`TRANSACTION_OPEN` | Payment has yet to be submitted.
`PAYMENT_AUTHORIZED` | Payment has been authorized for settlement.
`PAYMENT_AUTHORIZATION_EXPIRED` | Authorized payment was not manually settled within the allowed time by the card provider.
`PAYMENT_SETTLING` | Payment is settling. Transaction will be reconciled at a later date.
`PAYMENT_SETTLED` | Payment has settled.
`PAYMENT_FAILED` | Payment has failed.
`TRANSACTION_VOIDED` | Transaction has been explicitly voided.
`TRANSACTION_EXPIRED` | Transaction was not settled within the given time to live.

#### Validation errors

One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request.

Code | Description
- | - 
`TRANSACTION_NOT_FOUND` | Reference didn't match a known transaction.
`REFERENCE_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`REFERENCE_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`REFERENCE_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.*+:@&=,!~;`.

exec: var unsignedSignature = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + bodySignature;
var hmac = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + signedSignature;
